title: Crisp Chipotle Shrimp With Corn And Scallions
summary: Need a dairy free and pescatarian main course? Crisp Chipotle Shrimp With Corn And Scallions could be a spectacular recipe to try. For $3.0 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe makes 4 servings with 452 calories, 31g of protein, and 19g of fat each. 11 person have tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 40 minutes. A mixture of panko, shrimp, mayonnaise, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the panko you could follow this main course with the Panko Crusted Brownie Pie as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 65%. This score is solid. Try Dinner Tonight: Crisp Chipotle Shrimp with Corn and Scallions, Pasta with Corn, Scallions and Chipotle-Tomato Sauce, and Cheesy Chipotle Shrimp and Corn Dip for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 26 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.
